pull_requests.body: My last comment is "Sort issue and PR list by date_added", leave a comment if you have problem for updating my repo.

pull_request_comments.body: I check the result. My query is also not correct. Some issue comments link to the wrong issue. `(issue_id, json_id)` in issue_comment table doesn't match `(id, json_id)` in issues table. I will try to figure it out later.

Version 2:
```
"SELECT 
    'comment' AS type, issue_comments.date_added AS date_added, issues_json.title AS title, issue_comments.body AS body, 'repo/issues/view/?' || issues_json.site || '/' || issues_json.id || '@' || REPLACE(issues_json.directory, 'data/users/', '') AS url 
FROM 
    issue_comments 
LEFT JOIN 
    (SELECT * FROM issues LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id)) AS issues_json 
ON
    (issue_comments.issue_id = issues_json.id AND issue_comments.issue_json = issues_json.directory) 
WHERE 
    issues_json.site IN (:params) AND issue_comments.json_id IN (SELECT json_id FROM json WHERE json.site = issues_json.site)"
```

It works when I use sqlite3 in command line. But after I throw it to users.json, ZeroHello doesn't show anything. Can you test it?

```diff
- LEFT JOIN 
-     (SELECT * FROM issues LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id)) AS issues_json
+ LEFT JOIN 
+    (SELECT id, title, body, json_id, site, directory FROM issues LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id)) AS issues_json 
```
